ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Good engagement with Black literary canon relevant to Coming of Age experiences
Great understanding of coming of age texts in the black canon
THE BEST COURSE AT YALE! Take it for the literature and for Dean
Developed and practiced close reading skills

Before ENGL 360, I'd never questioned at length the notion of "coming of age." This courseits reading list, seminar discussionsprompted me to expand my understanding of the phrase, both generally and in relation to black literature. Perhaps because of the temporal range covered by the syllabus readings, our discussions sometimes focused also on the intersections between a given text and the culture (of readership, etc.) into which it enters.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: I loved this class! one novel a week, wide range of literature, current and older, well-known authors, poetry fiction and plays included
Weaknesses: none, except high workload and I didn't feel like I learned as much as I could have from the first writing assignment
Really great course, dont really see any room for improvement

As I do with many once-a-week seminars, I found myself wondering if ENGL 360 might be better suited to a 75-min, twice-a-week schedule. Otherwise, the course was fantastic. In my senior spring, it was my third of three Tuesday classes, back-to-back with another 1h50m seminar, and it ended after 5:00 PM. I could name the (many) specific strengths of the course, but perhaps I say more by mentioning that I left the class, each week, feeling rejuvenated and excited.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! I would recommend this course to anyone. I really enjoyed the course and Dean Mahurin's teaching style. The writers included are exceptional and integral to the Black literary canon and the American canon. There is a lot to gain from this course if you bring active engagement and a commitment to read a lot.

Absolutely! This has been one of the best and most rewarding classes I have taken at Yale. It is a lot of work, but all of it is worth it. I cannot wait to take another class with Prof Mahurin. This is a must-take class. No question about it.
I definitely would. Awesome Professor and important subject matter
ENGL 360 had a varied and exciting reading list, as well as unfailingly vibrant discussions; I'd recommend it to any student enthusiastic about literature.
Absolutely! Every person at Yale who is interested in Black literature in any capacity should take a class with Professor Mahurin!

extras.title: AFAM 322 01/ENGL 360 01 - Coming of Age in Black Lit
